720890f-a.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street
720890f-a.text:
117-119 Leonard Street, north side, between Lafayette Street and
Benson Place, showing the 3-story building occupied by the Elliott
Addressing Machine Company.
About 1924.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
720890f-a.folder: Leonard Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720889f-a.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street
720889f-a.text:
Leonard Street (right), north side, east from Lafayette, across
Centre to Bayard Streets. Prominently shown is the Tombs prison
occupying the sqqquare block north to Franklin Street. The latter
thoroughfare separates this from the Criminal Courts, a portion of
which appears at the upper left.
1939
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTIONS
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
''Portrait of N. Y.'' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
720889f-a.folder: Leonard Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720750f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Leonard Street
720750f-a.text:
(1)
Lafayette Street, west side, north from and including Leonard Street.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A portion of the same, at a later date, showing the block from
Leonard to Franklin Streets. Also shown (right.foreground) is a portion
of the Tombs Prison, andfleft fore) excavated area at the S.E. corner of
Leonard Street, for the new Department of Health Building. In the back-
ground appears the N.Y. Telephone Co. Building undergoing renovations.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720750f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Leonard Street, Manhattan, NY

720887f-a.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street
720887f-a.text:
Leonard Street, east from Lafayette to Baxter Streets, and show-
ing on the north side of same, the Tombs and a cleared area divided
by Centre Street. Beyond this new Criminal Courts (and prison)
ldg. site is Columbus Park.
The Church spire seen is that atop the Transfiguration Roman
Catholic Church in Chiratown and located at the N.W. corner of Mott
and Park Streets.
July 4, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720887f-a.folder: Leonard Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

1507590-a.title: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street
1507590-a.folder: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720888f-a.title: Manhattan: Leonard Street - Lafayette Street
720888f-a.text:
(1)
Lsonard Street, north side, east from Lafayette Street, to
and including Centre Street, showing the Tombs. This view also
shows Lafayette Street, east side, north from and including
Leonard Street. The same view also shows Centre Street, at,
adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Leonard Street.
March 26, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from the street level.
About 1931.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same as View No. 1, but showing a comprehensive view northward
on Lafayette itreet, and a general view of the neighboring area.
Excavated area seen on the south side of Leonard Street is for the
new Department of Health Building.
March 26, i51.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720888f-a.folder: Leonard Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY
